alert.note: Alert for Green Lake; Marquette (Wisconsin) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued April 13 at 10:01PM CDT until April 14 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Milwaukee
info.description: ...Critical Fire Weather Conditions Possible Again Friday Afternoon Toward Central Wisconsin... .The Red Flag Warning this evening has expired. Another round of critical fire weather conditions are possible toward central Wisconsin Friday afternoon, with elevated fire weather conditions elsewhere. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY MORNING THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING FOR UNSEASONABLY WARM TEMPERATURES, GUSTY SOUTH WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MARQUETTE AND GREEN LAKE COUNTIES... ...RED FLAG WARNING HAS EXPIRED FOR ALL OF SOUTHERN WISCONSIN THIS EVENING... * AFFECTED AREA...Marquette and Green Lake. * TIMING...For The Fire Weather Watch, from 11 AM until 8 PM CDT Friday evening. * WINDS...South 10 to 15 mph with gusts up to 25 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 22 percent. * TEMPERATURES...Highs near 80. * IMPACTS...Caution is advised when using outdoor fires and equipment that causes sparks. Make sure all outdoor fires are extinguished properly, and consult your local DNR office for possible burn bans.
info.instruction: A Fire Weather Watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible Red Flag Warnings.
